citation.article-title: Tepidiphilus margaritifer gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from a thermophilic aerobic digester.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Tepidiphilus (Te.pi.di′phi.lus. L. adj. tepidus lukewarm; Gr. adj. philos friendly to; N.L. masc. n. Tepidiphilus liker of lukewarm conditions).
Forms rod-shaped cells that stain Gram-negative.
Grows anaerobically in the presence of nitrate.
Major phospholipids are PE and PG; ubiquinone 8 is the major respiratory quinone.
Major fatty acids are C16 : 0 and cyclo-C19 : 0.
Organic acids and amino acids, but no sugars, are used as single carbon sources.
The type species is Tepidiphilus margaritifer.
